DataElement.preferredName: Physical Activity Rediness Questionnaire Chest Pain Absent Activity Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator of whether or not an individual experiences pain in the chest when not engaging in physical activity as described in the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire (PAR-Q).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire Chest Pain Absent Activity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The experience of pain in the chest when not engaging in physical activity as described in the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc. (from NIDDK Glossary; http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health/nutrit/pubs/glossary/glossaryintro.htm):No value exists.:Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument.

Concepts.definition: Any form of exercise or movement. Physical activity may include planned activity such as walking, running, basketball, or other sports. Physical activity may also include other daily activities such as household chores, yard work, walking the dog, etc.

Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.:The state of being active; any specific activity.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Modified to facilitate reuse by C3D adopters. mc 4/8/08

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indicator of whether or not an individual is ready for physical activity as described by the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
